system.description: You tap energy from the Plane of Shadow to cast a quasi-real, illusory version of a sorcerer or wizard evocation spell of 4th level or lower. The spell is 20% real. For example, a shadow fireball deals 1 point of fire damage per die (minimum 1) to creatures that fail their saves, and the shadow wall of ice has 20% of the hardness and hit points of a real wall. Objects in the environment react to the shadow spell as if it were real. If the disbelieved spell has a damaging effect, that effect is one-fifth as strong. If the disbelieved spell has a nondamaging effect, the effect is 20% likely to work. Unbelievers see the spell as a transparent, ghostly image.
